chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> is_pwd l

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
is_pwd_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_pwd_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> P tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_pwd l -> P l
is_wf_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> Prop, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
is_wf_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> SProp, P nil -> (forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> P tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> P ((p, n) :: tail)) -> forall l : list (nat * nat), is_wf l -> P l
in_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf l -> is_prime p /\ n > 0
rel_prime_wf : forall (l : list (nat * nat)) (p n q m : nat), In (p, n) l -> is_wf ((q, m) :: l) -> rel_prime p q
prime_divides_refactor : forall (p : nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> is_wf l -> divides (refactor l) p -> exists m : nat, In (p, m) l
factorisation : forall n : nat, {l : list (nat * nat) | is_wf l /\ n = refactor l} + {n = 0}
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
factor_divides_refactor : forall (x : nat * nat) (l : list (nat * nat)), In x l -> divides (refactor l) (power (fst x) (snd x))
Inductive is_pwd : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_pwd : is_pwd nil | cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_pwd _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_pwd (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope _ _%function_scope
refactor = fix refactor (l : list (nat * nat)) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | (p, n) :: tail => power p n * refactor tail end : list (nat * nat) -> nat Arguments refactor _%list_scope
Inductive is_wf : list (nat * nat) -> Prop := nil_is_wf : is_wf nil | cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail) Arguments is_wf _%list_scope Arguments cons_is_wf (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope
cons_is_pwd : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_pwd tail -> (forall n0 : nat, ~ In (p, n0) tail) -> is_pwd ((p, n) :: tail)
cons_is_wf : forall (p n : nat) (tail : list (nat * nat)), is_prime p -> n > 0 -> is_wf tail -> rel_prime p (refactor tail) -> is_wf ((p, n) :: tail)
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N true andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N true andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev false true xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) false true bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
in_inv : forall (A : Type) (a b : A) (l : list A), In b (a :: l) -> a = b \/ In b l
Field_theory.Field_simplify_eq_pow_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> req (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe1) (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe2)
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr N * Ring_polynom.PExpr N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1 Init.Nat.mul) l pe2
Ring_polynom.ring_rw_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe) (Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp cO cI ceqb phi get_sign l npe)
Field_theory.Fnorm_crossproduct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> req (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe1) (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe2)
Field_theory.Field_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> (forall p q : R, req p q -> req (rinv p) (rinv q)) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req ->...-> req (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe1) (Field_theory.FEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv phi Cp_phi rpow l fe2)
Ring_polynom.ring_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe1) (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe2)
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Qfield.Qfield_field_lemma3 : forall (n : nat) (l : list QArith_base.Q) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr QArith_base.Q * Ring_polynom.PExpr QArith_base.Q)) (fe1 fe2 : Field_theory.FExpr QArith_base.Q), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist {| QArith_base.Qnum := 0; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} {| QArith_base.Qnum := 1; QArith_base.Qden := 1 |} QArith_base.Qplus QArith_base.Qmult QArith_base.Qminus QArith_base.Qopp QArith_base.Qeq (IDphi (R:=QArith_base.Q)) Z.of_N QArith_base.Qpower l lpe -> forall lmp : list (QArith_base.Q * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol QArith_base.Q), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list {| QArith_base.Qnum := ...

```coq
intros l Hwf.
apply is_pwd_sind.
- apply nil_is_pwd.
- intros p n tail Hpwd Hrec Hnotin.
  apply cons_is_pwd.
  + assumption.
  + intro n0.
    intro Hin.
    apply Hnotin.
    apply in_inv in Hin.
    destruct Hin.
    -- absurd (p = p); auto.
    -- assumption.
Qed.```

original: intros l Hwf. apply is_pwd_sind. - apply nil_is_pwd. - intros p n tail Hpwd Hrec Hnotin. apply cons_is_pwd. + auto. + intro n0. intro Hin. apply Hnotin. apply in_inv in Hin. destruct Hin. -- absurd (p = p); auto. -- auto.
